intro: Alopecurus elongatus, commonly known as slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, hairless leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows, woodlands, and stream banks. Its flowers are wind-pollinated, and it produces small, three-angled seeds that are dispersed by wind. Alopecurus elongatus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
